II.ii.2.B.3.a
.
Confidentiality Requirement Under 38 U.S.C. 7332
The statutory guidelines of
38 U.S.C. 7332
require the confidentiality of VA records pertaining to human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) or acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS), alcohol abuse, drug abuse, or sickle cell anemia.
This statute also requires the confidentiality of information received, obtained, or maintained by an employee or contractor of VA for the purpose of performing HIV, AIDS, alcoholism, drug abuse, or sickle cell anemia program functions regarding an identifiable patient.
For the purpose of this block, a program function includes
treatment
rehabilitation
education
training
evaluation, and
research.
title: M21-1, Part II, Subpart ii, Chapter 2, Section B - Restricted Records Storage and Control
